name: 1-Methyl-1-nitrosourea
Reason:
To predict the melting point of 1-Methyl-1-nitrosourea, we will consider the functional groups present and their contribution to the melting point. The basic unit here could be urea, which has a melting point of about 133°C. The nitroso group tends to lower the melting point due to less efficient packing, we can estimate each nitroso group to reduce the melting point by about -20°C. A methyl group usually raises the melting point due to increased van der Waals forces; we can estimate each methyl group to add around +5°C. 1-Methyl-1-nitrosourea has one nitroso group and one methyl group. Thus: 
133°C (urea base) - 20°C (nitroso group) + 5°C (methyl group) = 118°C.
